features.title: One world, one game
hero.tagline: Exotic cultures, unexplored lands, and untold ways of thinking and being. The thrill and taste of the unknown shape every choice and consequence.
hero.title: For those who crave discovery
page.description: For those of us who crave DISCOVERY. A journey through exotic cultures, unexplored lands, weird creatures, and untold ways of thinking and being—yearning to experience the vast potentials, technologies and moralities of worlds unlike ours.
page.title: THE DISCORDING TALES – Under our steps awake those mysteries believed to be warring among the stars…
peoples.35: Prove worth by action; austèles, Labyrinthe.
races.ambres: Their tamer-healers convince fauna and flora to revive each spring through the musicality of their tromoroches.
races.arboricoles: The first shamans are said to have all died in the misty passes of Izkaraï. They invented mount-rails for their mad deminers who defuse the exponential growth bubbles from those deadly mists.
races.bas: High and Low Iqqars possessed themselves as one in a great wind-guided surge. Together they descended upon the lands of the Bêstres to celebrate their union through an ecstatic triumph of every body.
races.carmin: They claimed to have discovered these living beings in the greatest depths of the oceans; today they produce our communications through their lights, smokes and shifting colours that we grow, arrange and send.
races.chromatiques: Ancient masters of lands once decorated with their giant symbols marking the hills' soils that change colour with the seasons. Their gemmologist-locksmiths wield rolling strongboxes, téléstoles towers and mechanical télécordions.
races.collinicoles: Born in the mountains overlooking the hills, they held their vast fairs inside their mastodons. Their breeder-lenders created the kingdoms of cattle and the Golden Cord. Their cratocorax lever-armours increase their strength.
races.d_eau: Their sophisto-perfumers raised these volatiles that recognise any marked individual or thing, communicating through special waters for study or political ends.
races.danse_feuilles: Once seized by a collective dance frenzy, they were swept into the uncontrollable rhythms of leaves in the wind, which marked their souls. They developed diplo-traumas and hydrore elevators to glide through their branch-canals and trunk-canals.
races.des_monts: In their joviality they danced their prophecies with their fingers on the corpses of the vanquished to torment storms upon their enemies. Each danced body was for them a chance to reach their ancestors, whom they seek to rejoin by their crystal chariots.
races.des_plaines: Born of the warlike conquest of their singing statue, they still sing when they slaughter in peace and harmony through their téléséismes vibrating across the plains, amplifying their words and relaying their knowledge.
races.des_souffles: Their juice sommeliers delight all, and their buried drums make the tubules of our mastodons vibrate to one rhythm, inaudible to any who do not possess them.
races.de_lunes: Blessed by the eight moons in their fertility of spirits, their white or grey eyes shine at night when they set out eightfold, resonating their tymbafrons to revulse the unwanted, so as to welcome the ninth moon from which they would originate.
races.elesihin: Born under a sky where the stars seemed to align in ancient auguries, they became guardians of the secrets of time; their time-seers see through blue rocks and desert pink sands, and the echoes of ages past and future.
races.felichrem: The dream-tamers Felichrem, through their téléatmique network crossing the dunes while burning them, are said to have given all the habits, desires and needs—wild or not—of nearby beings through their tubed words reaching them all.
races.fleuris: They would descend from the lost colony of Uyahel. Their artisans aligned their sails, planks and rails with the world's attractive forces to send these Bêstres afar.
races.hlabayan: Awakened from the snows by the mysterious tremors of the sky. Armed with pneumocorax armour whose vapours melt all snow, the Hlabayan wall-walls are said to have formed the first walls guarding every bastion.
races.iohadam: Heirs of a glorious past of hallucinated cities, they saw their most precious artefacts scattered. The dream-labourers now cultivate spectacular mirages that shimmer on the horizon. Héliergonic tools capturing the sun's energy and the river's water.
races.iqqars_bas: The High and Low Iqqars possessed themselves as one in a great wind-guided surge. Together they descended upon the lands of the Bêstres to celebrate their union through an ecstatic triumph of every body.
races.iqqars_hauts: Unlike other separated and forgotten Races, the High and Low Iqqars possessed themselves as one in a great wind-guided surge. Together they descended upon the lands of the Bêstres to celebrate their union through an ecstatic triumph of every body.
races.ikrayad: Ancient adepts of a secret order that emerged from the dunes of intoxicating dust, masters of concealment. Their shadow-walk would be at the origin of all mirages. Their téléhélique networks allow coded messages to be sent in a furtive flash.
races.iossolam: They are said to have once cultivated the thermal oases. Their burn-sages still meditate in the depths of their golden scorching oases, using cryothermic cannons whose projections pump all heat.
races.limnicoles: They are said to have survived in secret cities within the chasms. Their mired inventors produce inventions such as aerial or aquatic physiosemy that react to change colour and texture to reveal secrets.
races.mache_troncs: Isolated and omitted by others, they pursued an ancient war they believed eternal. Their officer-jugglers, masters of martial poetry, one day made their hydrobèle trebuchets dance on their hydropyrgue siege towers far beyond hope.
races.marche_reves: Through divination of their floating, alienating rocks, their spiritual guides with blades that cut all hid or revealed our words to everyone during the purge by reading with their fingers the precious changing textures and forms of these stones.
races.monte_foudres: They would have lost their emotions to their muscles during their longest, most warlike rugged transhumance. Their nomapalais mercenaries lost across the hostile far lands. Their wrestler-riders defend our archives with their pavoises growing with every clash.
races.nuotarjoy: Formerly guided by the luminous apparitions of beings with strange silhouettes who crossed their misty marshes. Their river-pullers built unshakeable citadels on mountains and flows.
races.ordol: Marked by a mysterious knowledge from the farthest skies, they often speak of the invisible stars that guided their ancestors. Their ludo-rhetors are known for their extravagant stakes. Their navhélion boats capture solar rays to propel their vessels across the dunes.
races.pastoraux: They are said to have returned to life from a past that had once petrified them like an army, emerging from a great nécribunal. They brought back from the past their hypsébole catapults and tensodrome rails to send carriages and supplies to their cities.
races.perce_vague: Their marine confectioners know how to fulfil anyone's desire, even to open the way between all things with their bridges growing beyond any terrain, pit or river.
races.petricole: With their eat-alls in their courts and kitchens they discovered the medicinal falsehoods of consuming our lifeless bodies. They understood the harmony between beasts and ourselves to fulfil our needs together, down to lighting the depths of the oceans.
races.saute_brumes: They are said to have seen from their highest tree a city of light in their sky before it vanished. Their caravanners with mastodons raised in and born of gold navigate even upside down on the walls.
races.sydru_kal: They are said to have once been exhumed from their snowy graves before being redressed to resume their danced lives. The Sydru-kal glide-breaths would be so skilled they could float dancing on the cutting winds.
races.sylvains: They are said to have inherited their animal grace and delicacy by sacrificing those monsters in their arboreal springs, where their doctors climb with their adhesive gloves and whose armour vanishes in the reflections of the waters.
races.troglodytes: They led ritual clashes where every gesture of their tale-singer masters resonated in harmony with the aquatic echoes. Their hydrosemic aires conformed the waters to their words. Their canal and valve téléhydrie pressing water into words.
races.wijriol: The guttural chants of the Wijriol musk-howlers, who would control the snows of perfumes produced by their voices to steer their atmonaute boats floating in the air, will be heard.
pitch.depths: IN THE BLOSSOMING DEPTHS OF THE FORGOTTEN EARTH, THERE IS ONLY
pitch.golden: The seeds of a Golden Age Rush are sown—every paradise struggles for its overcoming.
pitch.intro: A baroque world worthy of myths and their mystical technologies. Alien peoples flourish through perpetual conflict in extreme environments.
pitch.question: Will it be your golden age, quenched and growing by your creative vision?
site.tagline1: Under our steps in a far, far future…
site.tagline2: awoke those mysteries believed to be warring among the stars.
site.title: THE DISCORDING TALES
tpl.107: The rules and sheets are designed to be mechanically elegant however complex they may appear at first glance.
tpl.109:
Each rule is modular, solving a variety of situations in a logical manner (WITHOUT having you to refer to a table).
It was made for those of us sick of abstract and messy restrictions, YET who still want our decisions to be mechanically impactful rather than wished.
tpl.11: A baroque world of myths and mystical technologies. Ten peoples in conflict, each with a morality that sets them apart—and a stage where every paradise struggles for its overcoming.
tpl.110: Hence the fundamental keyword for this ruleset:
tpl.112: This allows you to create your character throughout the first sessions, as if unfolding naturally, because each rule block is modular (independent and optional), rather than a dense weave of contextual rules.
tpl.114: …with their own morality, cultures in tension, and distinct traits.
tpl.116: Emerging from 8 attributes, seasons, and types of challenges (fights to debates), ailments (wounds to resentments), and environments (pressure to radiation).
tpl.118: …rewarding your roleplay, and 24 actions (crafting to tracking)—always new ways to deal with the world.
tpl.120: Discovered through play—many specializations for each, so you can pursue eccentric builds without choice paralysis.
tpl.123: You start with 5 dice (+, 0, −). Experience and ailments add or subtract dice. Results stay clear and readable.
tpl.126: Discordant Dice (dD): 3 faces: +, -, 0. Result = number of + minus number of -. Example: ++-0- = +1.
tpl.128: Every failed struggle marks your character—and generates experience in the skill used. What doesn't kill you makes you stronger. At 10 marks you realise something about that skill; learning overlaps (armed combat teaches a bit of unarmed).
tpl.129: You gain a die in the skill, a die in a specialization, and a step in the related attribute—and unlock feats at milestones.
tpl.131: Embrace suffering to assert your will—you grow through recovery. Ailments shape play: a wound burdens physical tasks, resentment hinders focus. Conditions vary: floods, firestorms, darkness, pressure.
tpl.132: —One against many, and many against one—
tpl.133: Alignments rethought for a world beyond relativism and dogmatism:
tpl.134: The Discording Tales of many goods and evils.
tpl.135: Everyone has a perspective on People and Things—power struggles across kinds and kingdoms, all seeking to rule.
tpl.136: From suicidal generosity to sustainable cannibalism—these kings and beggars flourish because their reasons to be exult life beyond mere survival.
tpl.138: Traits & Values are clear one-liners that anchor your character when the world alienates. Eight discordant perspectives (Success, Faith, Generosity, Survival…) can heal insanity and resentment; others come from your people, your personality, your role.
tpl.139: You suffer from your actions upon the world—and recover from what it did to you. You may want to change. But without a scar?
tpl.140: Reward the strong, spend on pleasures, share with the weak, or test a weapon.
tpl.145: Encounters — from a lone creature to an army; admiring or hostile; holding the keys to your quest or working against you.
tpl.147: Each attribute links to three aptitudes. Together they define what your character can attempt and how far they can go.
tpl.16: The world as they know it
tpl.17: Most cultures believe they live in a concave universe—a hollow where space rushes into a sphere of rock. The ground under their feet may be endless.
tpl.170: The system proposes 8 types of gameplay directly linked to the 8 Aptitudes. Use a "Key" (tool, knowledge, contact) to obtain the Object or pass the Obstacle in any conflict type.
tpl.176: Kill or Destroy and take the Object
tpl.177: Kill or Destroy the Obstacle and pass
tpl.179: Steal the Object here and in discretion
tpl.182: Make the holder abandon the Object
tpl.185: Take by force the secured Object
tpl.188: Trade the Object for a need
tpl.19: There is no creation from nothing. Their universe is always in motion, without beginning—infinite continuity, not a single zero point.
tpl.192: Find a solution to the Obstacle
tpl.194: Pillage a cache of the Object
tpl.195: Find a flaw in the Obstacle
tpl.2: Battle and debate. Infiltrate and investigate. Craft and unravel. Travel and feast. Every kind of conflict has its place.
tpl.200: Your character is revealed in three steps: heritage, individuation, and story. You can unfold them across the first sessions or fix them before play.
tpl.201: A) Caractéristiques — Origin, People, Race, Sex; base attributes
tpl.203: C) Récit — Reason for Awakening, Caste, Story (18 Récits); optional Attache & Héritage
tpl.204: Then choose: Remémoration Créatrice (deferred, in play) or Révélation complète (before first session)
tpl.207: Choose Origin (Yômmes, Yôrres, Bêstres), then a People, then one Race, then Sex. Base attributes come from People (by sex) and Race. Default: young adult, normal build for the People.
tpl.209: Yôrres: Hauts Ylfes, Ylfes pâles, Ylfes des lacs, Iqqars
tpl.21: The world and its invisible phenomena are explained as cords braided from two strands, knotting into every element—intangible, invisible to the senses.
tpl.211: Example races: Aristois → Monte-Foudres, Fleuris, Des Souffles, Ambrés. Slaadéens → Hlabayan, Sydru-kal, Felichrem, Iossolam, Wijriol.
tpl.219: To deviate from the norm: roll 5 times 10dD (no keep-5) for Niv of: (1) Âge, (2) Sexe, (3) Gras, (4) Stature, (5) Taille. Result 0 = People norm. Each Niv modifies attributes per the book tables (e.g. Maturité +1 Âge: -1 FOR, AGI, DEX, VIG, +1 EMP, -1 PER, -1 CRÉ, +1 VOL).
tpl.22: The whole universe would stem from one continuous cord, braided upon itself, whose knots are the Rils.
tpl.229: Starting from the attributes from A, diversify with one of the following. Quick (no dice): assign exactly +2, +1, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, -2 to the 8 attributes (one value per attribute). Final = base from A + this. Then multiply each Niv by ×10 for the sheet. ±5 Niv vs People norm = EXTRÊME; -6 or below = fatal (reroll or change). Gregarious Peoples: -8 N per Niv de Gouvernance.
tpl.231: Variabilité réaliste: 8× (10dD/2), add each result to one attribute (order or choice).
tpl.232: Variabilité équilibrée: Total of 8 attributes = 0 (or group target); adjust Niv to match.
tpl.233: Variabilité contrôlée: 20dD → Degrés to spend per table below.
tpl.234: Niv Atb / Coût en Degrés / Coût Total
tpl.240: Roll 5dD + 1d6 (or choose) to determine why the character leaves their life / sets out. Use the table below.
tpl.243: Flee economic pressure, Earn money, Delivery, Escort, Flee family, Seek healthy climate
tpl.244: Maintain roads, Open business, Flee marriage/pregnancy, Hunt, Mine resources, Mediation
tpl.245: Explore ruins, Learn secrets, Nomadic work, Patrol, Art/history research, Religious fervour
tpl.246: Raids, Military transfer, Flee accusation, Build community, Save/convert, Observation
tpl.247: Adventure itself, Disinheritance, Follow visions, Assassination, Flee persecution, Rumours of wealth
tpl.248: Create routes, “Because it's there”, Family pressure, Rescue, Explore new places, Conversion
tpl.25: Ô (World/Location) is the spirit forming all forms—eternally cradled between pain and relief.
tpl.250: Your highest Attribute determines your Caste. Each Caste has 18 Récits (3 sous-castes × 6 récits). Roll d3 = sous-caste, d6 = specific Récit. Your Récit doubles the CT dice in situations that fit it; if you have 0 Dé in that skill, add +1 Dé. Optional: Variation des Récits (10dD/2) to pick another Caste than the highest Attribute.
tpl.27: WÔM (Time/Count) is Ô's twin, perched far away—reconciling all by judgment, establishing wealth and the extent of each realm.
tpl.271: Attache: Draw or choose an Attache linked to your Récit (sous-caste and alignment -, 0, +) to anchor past and present.
tpl.272: Héritage: Roll 5dD. If result ±3, ±4 or ±5: roll 3dD for Heritage type, then 5dD for value X (intensity). Write Heritage name and X; total all attributes after People, Race, Sex, Individuation and Héritage.
tpl.273: After the 3 steps: choose your path
tpl.275: Deferred revelation in play: the character has “amnesias” and recovers memory over 8 aspects across sessions. First session: Symbole, Dés Éduqués/Exprimés, Marques gratuites, etc. You make choices as you become aware of needs through play, rather than deciding everything in advance.
tpl.279: Values and traits that guide decisions (valeurs et traits).
tpl.283: Finalise the character before play with the following.
tpl.284: Symbole: nature, essence, destiny, passions. Aptitude Symbolique = 3 Actions; Fascinante = 2; Intéressante = 1.
tpl.285: Éducation: Compétence Familiale (+3 Dés), Compétences Éduquées (Marques Éternelles). 10 Dés Éduqués.
tpl.286: Expression: 10 Dés Exprimés, spread in Symbolic (3 Actions), Fascinante (2), Intéressante (1).
tpl.29: HISM (Forces/Actions-at-Distance/Magic) is the dance of the tetrarchs—couples so close they form one whole, hating and adoring each other.
tpl.290: The magic (Rilie) emerges from the emotions of a goddess eternally tormented by 4 cosmic forces. Your personality is mechanical: Values heal Madness (Folies), Traits heal Grudges (Rancœurs). Experience flows from failure into Marques, Éprouver, and Réalisation; suffering accumulates as DS and is healed by Repos, treatments, or sacrifice of Values/Traits.
tpl.293: +1 Marque per Échec in a Revealed CT.
tpl.296: Marques fill the CT used; max 10 (minus Eternal Marques) → Éprouver.
tpl.297: Eternal Marques (Éduquées, Symboliques, Passionnées): never erased; reduce Marques needed to Éprouver.
tpl.299: 10 Marques (minus Eternal) = CT Éprouvée. An Éprouvée CT can be Réalisée at any moment (often at an epiphany). On Réalisation:
tpl.300: +1 Dé to that CT; Marques erased (except Eternal).
tpl.301: Free Marques to spend elsewhere = current Niv of the realised skill; cost by distance (see table).
tpl.302: +1 to one linked ATB (or exchange 5 free Marques for +1 ATB).
tpl.303: If new Niv: +1 Potentiel d'Action, Découverte; 5th Niv of any CT reduces 5 DS on the roll. If Degré only: +1 Maîtrise (MT), max MT = Niv of that CT.
tpl.304: Cost of free Marques (by distance to Réalisée CT)
tpl.311: Exchange for +1 ATB linked to CT
tpl.313: Distinction = sum of all Attribut levels (e.g. -50 to +50). Gain a Distinction level when an Attribut gains +10. At each Distinction: choose one of 4 Attribut Découvertes for that Attribut. 5th Distinction in same Attribut/Aptitude → extreme Attribut Découverte (book p. 98).
tpl.316: Determined by the Aptitude where you spend the most Dés Exprimés (or highest Niv). The other two linked Aptitudes become Fascinante and Intéressante.
tpl.317: Symbolic: 3 Actions underlined; 3 Eternal Marques (Symboliques) in CTs of those Actions.
tpl.318: Fascinante: 2 Actions underlined; 2 connected Marques in CTs.
tpl.319: Intéressante: 1 Action underlined; 1 Marque (vertical stroke) in CTs.
tpl.321: 10 Dés Éduqués: 3×+1 D (People/APT), 2×+2 D (Race), 1×+3 D (Family CT). Placed on Actions first; in play assign to a concrete CT of that Action (name the CT). No Marques in a CT until you have spent at least 1 Dé there and written its name. Eternal Marques Éduquées: Familial +3 = 3; Racial +2 = 2 each; Popular +1 = 1. 10 Dés Exprimés: spend during play in any Action (then assign to a CT), according to character history.
tpl.323: Dice applied to all rolls (with DS) and Rilie effects. Initial: +1 Élan at first session, or 5dD + Distinction. Change only by RESSENTIMENT (refuse/flee/deviate/venge → reduce Élan) or CONSENTIMENT (embrace suffering, roll Valeurs/Traits → success = +1 Élan per Dé healed). At -5 Élan: Ressentiment only allows reducing Niv de Valeur vs X DS of another Souffrance. At +5 Élan: each extra Élan reduces 1 Jour of Souffrance.
tpl.325: Eight kinds of burden: Maux (Wounds, Bonds, Madness, Grudges) and Besoins (Fatigue, Deprivations, Addictions, Illnesses). Each burdens different aspects of your character; they shape play and recovery.
tpl.340: You passively absorb DS equal to your Niv of Resistance CT for that mal + any equipment. There is no resistance roll. Each failure counted as Souffrance that exceeds this becomes DS and gives a Marque in that Resistance CT.
tpl.342: DS from the ATB 3 & 2 of an Aptitude subtract from extra dice (CT/MT) on rolls for that Aptitude. Example: 4 DS Blessures → -2 Niv on Puissance/Athlétisme passif (FOR 3 or 2), not Domination (FOR 1).
tpl.348: Passagère: +1 DS to one adjacent Souffrance
tpl.349: Durable: -1 Attribut until healing (e.g. heal to -9 DS if at -12)
tpl.350: Permanente: member loss, -2 ATB or -1 to two (prothèse/Rilie can mitigate)
tpl.352: Physical Séquelles (Blessures/Entraves) = Infirmities; psychical (Folies/Rancœurs) = Excentricities. Optional: DURETÉ (1dD can shift Séquelle level), PITIÉ (+1/+2/+3 Dés to « Faire Pitié »), INSTINCT (survival: invert DS to positive for one roll, -1 Dé de Vie).
tpl.354: After each Jet de Repos: exchange 1 DS of a Mal (Wounds, Bonds, Madness, Grudges) for Jours de souffrance in a Besoin (Fatigue, Deprivations, Addictions, Illnesses), or the reverse.
tpl.356: Some Souffrances appear after a delay. After NdT 5 - Niv of the triggered suffering, test: 5dD + Resistance dice - ALL current DS + APT linked to Resistance. Each Échec → +1 DS and +1 Marque in that Resistance. Each extra Succès can remove 1 Jour de souffrance. If the Éveilleur points their own triggered Souffrance for their PI, +X Dés and +X Marques (X = Niv of Épreuve).
tpl.357: Saignements: test every 5-X NdT vs Niv X bleeding.
tpl.358: Exténuements: encumbrance beyond Niv → Épreuve vs Entraves/Fatigues.
tpl.359: Infections: after X-5 NdT, Niv d'Épreuve by virulence.
tpl.360: Intoxications: drug/poison 5-X NdT, Niv = activation + duration + effect.
tpl.361: Désirs: world recalls you; 5dD + Resistance - all DS vs Niv of desire.
tpl.363: 10+ total DS → Rage: roll 1d6; failure = instinctive action (DS can become positive dice for that action); 6 = can « Guider » the Rage. 15+ total DS → Unconsciousness or Defeated (Coma or Madness). Defeat: table for where you wake, state, what is missing; possessions can be lost (Niv d'Abondance may increase over time).
tpl.366: Jet de Repos (daily or by NdT) determines how many Jours de souffrance are healed; modified by Resistance, current DS, environment, rest type, food/drink. Successes on Repos (or on Triggered Suffering tests) remove Jours.
tpl.367: Soutiens: healer or suitable environment improves healing. Surdosage: taking drug again before test postpones to next 5-X NdT; excess treatments can cause new Addictions/Illnesses. Restaurations: food, drink, rest (see Aliments/Restauration, Niv de Guérison).
tpl.369: Each Souffrance has treatments by level (1 = simple, 5 = exceptional). Keywords below; full lists in Niv_de_Guérison_des_8_Souffrances.
tpl.4: Rules are modular—you solve situations without hunting through tables. Your character takes shape across the first sessions, as if unfolding naturally.
tpl.416: Treat with Valeurs (Morality, Motivation, Personality): sacrifice Niv de Valeur equal to the Niv of Souffrance to heal (e.g. Niv 3 Folies → sacrifice 3 Niv in a Value). See Values & Traits (Rules).
tpl.418: Treat with Traits (Sociality, Disposition, Passion): sacrifice Niv de Trait equal to the Niv of Souffrance to heal.
tpl.422: Combat is one of the 8 types of conflict. It runs in real time—no turns. Time is measured in Clins (1/3 second). You act with Proactions (attack, move) and Réactions (block, parry, dodge). Each choice adds Ébranlement (shock), which burdens your next actions. Tension and consequence, moment by moment.
tpl.424: Clin — 1/3 s
tpl.425: Clin d'Alerte — when you can act proactively
tpl.426: Proaction — multi-Clin action
tpl.427: Réaction — defensive response
tpl.428: Niv d'Ébranlement — shock level
tpl.429: Honoration — ritual action
tpl.432: Niv d'Ébranlement = Réactions + Mouvements (multiplied by simultaneous Proactions/cibles)
tpl.433: Block / Parry / Dodge at the last Clin of the attack
tpl.435: Time "blinks" (flows Clin by Clin) for everyone at once. Those whose Clin has not yet reached their Clin d'Alerte are Surpris and can only Réagir. Once you Réagir or are Touched while Surpris, you are no longer Surpris next Clin. Attaque sournoise: any Réaction while Surpris uses the difference between current Clin and Alert Clin as negative Dés (or Niv) on the roll.
tpl.436: Roll Vigilance [Détection] minus 5 minus X (by situation) for Alert; minimum at Clin -1. Situations: Alerté (0), Préparé (+5, e.g. ambush with Alert ally), Inattentif (-3), Bouleversé (-10). Respectively -1 | -3 | -6 | -10 Dés to your Alert roll.
tpl.438: You can always Réagir to any action, unless unconscious.
tpl.439: Clin d'Alerte determines when you can Proagir (act proactively).
tpl.440: You can cumulate Réactions simultaneously during one Proaction; they accumulate as Niv d'Ébranlement (negative) on related rolls.
tpl.441: Initiative: If two individuals conflict over the same thing at the same Clin, roll 1dD: (-) one declares first, (+) the other, (0) both declare at once. Declaration order only gives the other a chance to react; both still act in the same Clin.
tpl.443: Proactions are actions that take several Clins in a row (e.g. Reload, Charge or Discharge an Attack). Duration = number of Clins (often weapon Inertia). Declare and note at which Clin the action resolves (e.g. Proagir at Clin -2 for a 4-Clin action → resolves at Clin -6).
tpl.444: Recharger: Take ammunition (quiver) or weapon (sheath) → into hand → nock if ranged. Attaquer: Charge the weapon (draw string / arm) then release; at the last Clin make the weapon's Attack roll (damage, Success to spend on location/manœuvres).
tpl.445: Multiple Proactions: limited by limbs (e.g. ambidexterity). Declare Clins for each. Niv d'Ébranlement from Mouvements and Réactions is multiplied by number of simultaneous Proactions (and by number of targets if different). Ranged: Attack Clins = arming only; melee/jet: half Clins = arm, half = strike.
tpl.447: Réactions happen at the last Clin of an enemy Proaction. Each additional Réaction on the same Clin adds -1 Niv d'Ébranlement to your roll.
tpl.452: Each Niv d'Action beyond the first (Réactions, Mouvements, simultaneous Proactions) subtracts 1 Niv d'Ébranlement from all rolls that Clin (not counting the Attack itself). Ébranlement disappears next Clin unless you continue one of those actions. If you don't Réagir to an enemy Proaction, roll 5dD - Niv Taille - Niv Stature - Niv d'Ébranlement as base to compare to their attack.
tpl.454: Every -10 Clins, everyone rolls Jet de Souffle (Domination [Endurer]). Failure can cause Fatigue Souffrances. If you have no Niv d'Ébranlement (or after a successful Esquiver that grants Récupération), you can:
tpl.456: Ritual or symbolic actions that can modify rolls; linked to Rilie. Use before, during or after combat. Cost in Clins (see table: -15|10|6|3|1 Dés to Honoration roll vs -1|3|10|30|100 Clins).
tpl.472: I Clins; I/2 one hand; I×2 two hands
tpl.474: In bag/ground -10C → quiver -6C → hand -3C → finger -1C. Ease [Coordonner] = X Clins (min 1)
tpl.476: Clins = weapon IRT − Power (min 1). Mechanical (I×1…10); Corporeal (×I); Auto (X/1C)
tpl.48:
Domain: Whirling (Electromagnetism)
Actions: Hôi (assembles Riliôh (Unique Forms/Atom) into Rilhôi (Massive Forms/Mass) - causes attraction) / iôH (loosens knots of Rilhôi (Massive Forms/Mass), disperses into Riliôh (Unique Forms/Atom) - causes repulsion)
Rilical Family: Aèmrils (Whirling Forms/Airs)
tpl.492: Flat→Hammer; Round→Mace; Blade→Sword; Edge→Rapier; Tip/Point→Lance, Arrow. Pommel weapons: often 2 TRC + 1 PRF.
tpl.494: Multi-head (+X IRT or -1 DRT), Guards (+IRT & +GRD), Hooks (+MNV, -DRT), Rigid/Flexible, Refinement, Flare. Improvised: ×2 IRT and ×2 DRT (negative).
tpl.50:
Domain: Tension (Gravity)
Actions: Iôs (awakens Rilsôi (Immobile Forms/Immobility) into Riliôs (Moving Forms/Motion) - causes fall) / sôI (puts Riliôs (Moving Forms/Motion) to sleep into Rilsôi (Immobility) - causes elevation)
Rilical Family: Ormrils (Emotional Forms/Emotions)
tpl.507: Grapple (unarmed), Boots (armed), Ruse (general). More Successes = more manœuvres possible. Manœuvre Niv 1–5: Seized, Pushed, Thrown, Prone, Immobilised; recovery in 1–5 Clins or Équilibrer.
tpl.513: Magic (Rilie) comes from interaction with the Rils—the fundamental forms of the world—orchestrated by four cosmic forces (the tetrarchs). There are no spell lists. You honour the Rils through ritual; your Symbol and Values shape what is possible. Pain and relief, woven into the cosmos.
tpl.514: Cosmology (Ô, WÔM, HISM, Éo, oÀ, ÉoÀ)
tpl.515: Most cultures believe in a concave universe (Cytocosmism): a hollow where space folds within a sphere of rock; the "ground" under all feet is endless. No creation ex nihilo — infinite continuity. The invisible world is explained by cords of two strands knotting in each element; the whole universe would stem from one continuous cord whose knots are the Rils.
tpl.516: Ô (World / Location) — the ultimate Rildée (URRILDÉE), the rilique spirit forming all forms, eternally swayed between pain and relief, orchestrating the HISM.
tpl.517: WÔM (Time / Count) — Ô's twin, far off, reconciling all by judgment and setting the extent of each realm.
tpl.518: HISM (Forces / Actions-at-Distance / Magic) — the dance of the assembly of tetrarchs in couples so close they form one bicephalous whole (sometimes wrongly called « the » SZIIZS), hating as much as adoring. Hôi knots Ô, Iôs stretches Ô, Sôm aligns Ô, Môh twists Ô; the Zimwis (iôH, sôI, môS, hôM) undo when the Siôiz stray.
tpl.519: Éo (Electrified): first son of Ô, tears of rapture — weaves the Corps (Membrane) of each Ril-cendrée. oÀ (Magnetized): first daughter, shards of pain — animate the Cœur (Noyau). ÉoÀ (Illuminated): the unifying cord of Éo and oÀ, weaving the web that binds all riches.
tpl.52:
Domain: Alignment (Light)
Actions: Sôm (aligns Rilmôs (Invisible Forms/Invisibility) into Rilsôm (Visible Forms/Visibility) - causes appearance) / môS (hides Rilsôm (Visible Forms/Visibility) into Rilmôs (Invisibility) - causes disappearance)
Rilical Family: Esthrils (Manifesting Forms/Phenomena)
tpl.520: The four Tétrarques of the HISM
tpl.521: iôHôi, sôIôs, môSôm and hôMôh are the four artist-kings-and-queens of Ô, manipulating its thread in the melody of the HISM.
tpl.54:
Domain: Torsion (Transmutation)
Actions: Môh (embraces Rilhôm (Pure Forms/Purity) into Rilmôh (Mixtioned Forms/Mixtion) - causes change) / hôM (freezes Rilmôh (Mixtioned Forms/Mixtion) into Rilhôm (Purity) - causes persistence)
Rilical Family: Stadrils (Freezing Forms/Solids)
tpl.542: Hael, Féos & the eight lunar Rildées (WYTHSMÂH)
tpl.543: HAEL (Ground / Earth): fortress of impenetrable rock, guardian of the mysteries enclosing Ô. FÉOS (Sky / Cosmos): realm of the purest airs. The eight lunar Rildées (WYTHSMÂH) appear on the 5th, 10th, 15th, 18th, 24th, 30th, 36th and 45th (last) day of each Season; all attributes of Hael's societies depend on them.
tpl.547: ÛRDHWAUDÂM (« Built on High »): first temple (Héliorée de Fânéime); seventy-two towers; Yekkwuî and Âpsebjum built it. The book also mentions seven stellar Rildées (wandering stars).
tpl.549: Ril-cendrées (Atoms / Spirits) are the forms moving through Ô. For each: Corps (Membrane) is woven by Éo; Cœur (Noyau) is animated by oÀ. United, they are graspable; separated, evasive.
tpl.550: Rils-cendrées — solitary base forms; become the Rils of the world (beings, objects).
tpl.552: Rils — distinct mixtures (minerals, oils, perfumes); insects, bushes, cattle, ourselves.
tpl.553: Rildées — tutelary forms (forests, oceans, star-motions); can move regions or cities with a nod.
tpl.555: Rildées-astrales — order rhythms, values, seasons (Hael, Féos, eight Moons, seven stars).
tpl.556: Tétrarques de l'HISM — manipulate every Ril-cendrée and Rildée-astrale without being Rils themselves.
tpl.557: Ô (URRILDÉE) — the rilique spirit as a whole forming all other forms.
tpl.559: Siwômiz: the illuminated forest; all Rils belong to it (fruits of taste and substance). Siôiz (projections without sap) and Zimwis (notions without ground) are wandering, disembodied reflections and cannot ripen into real fruits.
tpl.56: Each people has a morality that sets them apart, cultures in tension with one another, and distinct traits. What you meet here will feel alien—and consequential.
tpl.560: RILIE: magic, unexplained phenomena, mediator beings of Actions-at-Distance; what appears as if from a breath or nod — « what comes from nowhere and without cause » — when one feels the dance of the HISM.
tpl.562: Ritual actions to interact with the Rils. The Initial Circle sets the effect; each additional effect level (+X) adds +3 Niv or +6 Dés, etc. Formula: INITIAL + Niv d'Effet + 1 or 2 TYPES of effects. See the "Honorations" reference table below. Honoration roll cost in Clins: -15|10|6|3|1 Dés to the roll vs -1|3|10|30|100 Clins (see Honoration cost table).
tpl.564: Eight families: Aèmrils (airs), Hygrils (liquids), Stadrils (minerals/solids), Physrils (plants/fungi), Zoosrils (animals), Esthrils (properties of things), Noûsrils (beliefs/morals/habits), Ormrils (emotions/memories/consciousness). Each family is linked to a MAUX (Souffrance): Blessures, Entraves, Fatigues, Disettes, Addictions, Maladies, Folies, Rancœurs.
tpl.565: Victime (via NdV): sacrifice NdV equal to a value (e.g. Grain -3N … Homme libre +6N, 3'000cO +7N); repeat or offend. Offrande (Taille + Quantité): until next Matinée; scale from Poudre/Plis to Entrepôt. Serment (via NdT): while respected; duration Instant (+0N) to Lune (+10N).
tpl.566: Niveaux de Ril 0–5: from faint (0: Soupir, Gouttelette, Poussière…) to mightiest (5: Tornade, Torrent, Pierre Précieuse, Arbre, Créature…). Équilibre: each family has an equilibrium cost and an avoidance condition (e.g. Aèmrils: breath weakens or dry cough; avoid direct contact with air).
tpl.568: Circle level depends on Distance (farthest target), Quantité (targets affected), Taille (largest target), Durée (longest effect). Each factor has a Niv from -2 to +8 (e.g. Distance: in self -2, around self 0, at sight 10 m +1, horizon 10 km +4, beyond stars +8; Durée: 1 Clin d'œil -2, Instant 0, Heure +1, … Millénaire +8). See reference table below.
tpl.570: The Prêtre (Éveilleur role) prepares and manages the group's Cercles / Sacrifices Riliques. Power: reduce one of the group's Rilique Honorations by 1 Cercle.
tpl.571: Rilie must be revealed as a Competence (training, discovery, heritage).
tpl.572: NdT not symbolically sacrificed: offense malus reduced by 1 per Symbole (see NdT in progression).
tpl.573: Possible costs: time, resources, Souffrances, Honorations (Cercles, Sacrifices, Serments).
tpl.574: Sanctuaires: sacred places linked to Rils; sacrifice can grant +1 Marque in an associated Revealed Competence.
tpl.580: Four Cercle Initial tables, one per Tétrarque (iôHôi, sôIôs, môSôm, hôMôh). Formula: INITIAL + Niv d'Effet + 1 or 2 TYPES of effects.
tpl.599: 8 families, MAUX, Niveaux de Ril 0–5, Victime/Offrande/Serment
tpl.6: From quick, single-roll moments to layered, multi-step challenges. Every path offers the same care and consequence.
tpl.613: Spend Clins to reduce the penalty on the Honoration roll (ritual/symbolic action linked to Rilie). Also see Combat > Clins & Types.
tpl.617: Roll on the Character Sheet, then tell the Éveilleur (GM) what you did and what happened. Your choices drive the story; the world responds. Use the chat to describe actions, report results, or ask about the world and the rules.
tpl.620: Ask about the world or rules
tpl.622: Kill this character and create a new one
tpl.626: The Discording Tales draws from traditions that already name part of what it is. Below, those genres in the light of this world and its rules.
tpl.628: Reality's complexity as foundation. The familiar—ghosts, vampires—radically reinterpreted to embody the uncanny again.
tpl.631: Vivid colours and intricate detail; architectural grandeur and animistic vibrancy. Every expression and landscape amplified.
tpl.634: The mundane is divine; nature is magical. Ordinary actions intersect with supernatural forces; the common becomes extraordinary.
tpl.635: Ex: TES III : Morrowind, Animisms, Zelda (Ocarina of Time & Majora's Mask)
tpl.637: Exoticism where poetry, darkness and humour mingle. Strange customs, anatomies, morals—odious, dangerous or ridiculous—always foreign, ungraspable. Everyone comes from elsewhere.
tpl.638: Ex: J. Vance's 'Planet of Adventure', Talislanta TTRPG, Tatooine's cantina
tpl.640: Technology that strengthens body and mind without dependence—the physical improvement of life. Animals as technology, by nature or by craft.
tpl.641: Ex: Astrolabes, Final Fantasy IX' mistpunk, Anti-terrorist bees or the Skekis' carriage.
tpl.643: Life beautiful despite everything. A 'yes' to creation and strength. Suffering as the ground of the triumphant.
tpl.644: Ex: F. Nietzsche's 'Thus spoke Zarathustra', Monster Hunter, Ghibli movies (somewhat)
tpl.646: Where and when dreams flourish. Not elegies for lost glories nor post-apocalypse—but the imminent dawn of (a) Golden Age(s). Wishes sown, about to burgeon.
tpl.647: Ex: The Discording Tales, Ancient mythical realms, The Renaissance
tpl.649: These works informed the world and the rules. An archive of what could be remembered.
tpl.653: Reworking TTRPG concepts (XP, HP, Time & Open table gameplay)
tpl.656: Factions: Tier, Status & Countdown clocks for goals
tpl.660: Actions as verbs containing skills, crafting scales, hostile conditions
tpl.661: Early starting point, General humor, Feats, Font (Dauphin)
tpl.662: Interactions between the Game Master & the Player Characters
tpl.663: Appearance & Emotional Status, Learning from a writer's issues
tpl.664: Medieval jobs, Humor alignment, Learning from a solodev's issues
tpl.665: Seeing beauty as a healing mechanic, Types of vehicle damages
tpl.666: Resource types, Crafts, Stronghold system, Quarts of Days
tpl.670: Tragedy, Development of regions, PCs rewarding the GM
tpl.671: Bullet points about the lore, Momentum mechanic
tpl.672: Segregated wound types merged into a singular unconsciousness
tpl.673: Mechanic/worldbuilding of Consensus reality and Magic paradox
tpl.674: Formatting: Mains points in describing Races & Monsters
tpl.675: Mise en abîme, Seasons, Traits, Duties, "Nature" as an Attribute
tpl.678: Early starting point, Rough guidelines, Base for item lists
tpl.680: Unique Stunts for the Mads or the Experienced
tpl.681: Evolving & Playing GM, Gamifying Metagaming, Travelling system
tpl.686: Creating a Coherent & Evocating setting, Class archetypes
tpl.687: Cultural differences impacting all interactions with cultural "items"
tpl.688: Lucky points, Luck as an Attribute, Luck mechanics
tpl.689: Caravans, Localities, Worldbuilding through rules, Market research
tpl.690: Parameters of a Society, Influencing a Society
tpl.691: Light as a Currency, Travelling mechanics, Very Alien "Typical" Races
tpl.692: Using the physical Book itself & its aspects as an external game tool
tpl.695: 4 pairs of 8 Attributes, Attribute system, Morality system
tpl.706: THE DISCORDING TALES – A Weird Ethno-Science-Fantasy Gameworld
tpl.718: Determines when you can Proact. States: Surpris (-5), Alerté (0), Préparé (+5), Inattentif (-3), Bouleversé (-10).
tpl.719: Multi-Clin actions: Reload, Attack, etc. Declare and note which Clin they resolve.
tpl.720: Block, Parer, Esquiver at the last Clin of enemy attack. Each adds Niv d'Ébranlement.
tpl.721: Accumulated by Réactions and Mouvements; subtracts from rolls; recovers next Clin.
tpl.722: Ritual/symbolic action; can modify rolls; linked to Rilie. Cost in Clins.
tpl.8: Hear the latest rumours from the depths.
tpl.84: The default stage is Iäoduneï: snow-capped dunes, burning waters, central mountains. Some 200,000 souls over 232,000 km². At its heart, the Mangroves d'Hylothermes—carmine-leaved mangrove trees and nomadic caravan-villages (Nomachome).
tpl.9: Sit by the Fireplace (Subscribe – no spam)
tpl.92: Slaadéens: N'la-Fatch (artistic high family; Felichrem, Iossolam), Souk'mans (infiltration), Braisois (sedentary, Heptahalie). Others: Rophanes (microcity-states), Daïnumes Aristois, Aïozhan & Zoluzhan Gomb (syndicates), Ennakleis, Jademarche.
tpl.94: Economic: Hunter-gatherers (Slaadéens) vs pastoralism (Aristois) vs agriculture (Ylfes des lacs).
tpl.95: Cultural: Nomads vs sedentary and semi-sedentary; techno-traditionalism (Gens vs Choses).
tpl.96: Religious: Heptahalie vs Oratoire Kaïaste vs Nomê Aristois vs Hahalumullio Ylfe.
tpl.98: A free-forming system where failure becomes progression. Your choices matter; the world responds.
